intro: Lappula alatavica, commonly known as the broadleaf lappula, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, lobed leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation across dry landscapes. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
